bestBHT.bht: The servant in this narrative adopts the same attitude and uses the same words that drew compassion from his master when he beseeches his fellow servant. Falling down in humility and earnestly pleading, he implores for patience, proclaiming his intent to repay the entire debt. The servant's successful employment of these very words with his master makes this interaction all the more significant.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: The same attitude, and the same words which drew compassion from his master, are here employed towards himself by his fellow servant.
Have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.
The same attitude, and the same words which drew compassion from his master, are here employed towards himself by his fellow servant.
Marvin Vincent: Besought [παρεκαλει] . The imperfect has the force of earnestly besought.
Philip Schaff: Fell down and besought him. As he had done his greater creditor.
I will pay thee. The best authorities omit ‘all.’ This may hint that we are far more ready to promise God than men, all we owe, though the first promise cannot be fulfilled.
John Gill: And his fellow servant fell down at his feet... in the most humble and submissive manner."
And besought him, saying, 'have patience with me, and I will pay thee all'; using the very same words, in which he had expressed himself to his Lord, and had succeeded.
Using the very same words... and had succeeded.

bhtAttempts.bht: The servant in this verse has employed the same attitude and words that drew compassion from his master towards himself, trying to beseech his fellow servant for patience and promising to repay him. This parallels the servant's previous encounter with his master, where he successfully used the same words. The servant falls down in a humble and submissive manner, just as he did before, earnestly beseeching his fellow servant.

The servant in this passage displays a striking similarity in both attitude and words to his master, drawing compassion as he beseeches his fellow servant for patience and promising to repay him. The servant falls down, humbly and submissively, reusing the very same words which were successful in the past.

The servant in this account mirrors his master's compassion as he implores his fellow servant for patience, uttering the exact words he used before. With a humble and submissive demeanor, he beseeches his fellow servant, promising to repay everything he owes.

The servant in this narrative adopts the same attitude and uses the same words that drew compassion from his master when he beseeches his fellow servant. Falling down in humility and earnestly pleading, he implores for patience, proclaiming his intent to repay the entire debt. The servant's successful employment of these very words with his master makes this interaction all the more significant.

The servant in this account approaches his fellow servant with a similar attitude and repeats the same words that elicited compassion from his master. Falling down in humility, he earnestly implores for patience, vowing to repay the entire debt. Notably, his employment of the exact words used with his master proves to be effective in this instance as well.
